title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 307.1 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 307.1 - Definitions

State Regulations

Whenever used in this Part: (a) The term calendar year employee shall
mean any person in the professional service having an annual obligation of
service for the full year; i.e., 12 months. (b) The term academic year employee shall
mean any person in the professional service having an annual obligation of
service for the academic year, as determined by the chief administrative
officer or his designee. (c) The
term college year employee shall mean any person in the professional service
having an annual obligation of service for any other period less than the full
year, as specified in the letter of appointment. (d) The term professional obligation shall
refer to the annual obligation of service of one of the foregoing. (e) The term base salary shall mean the
annual salary of an employee as existing immediately preceding the effective
date of any change of such employee's professional obligation. (f) The term salary adjustment shall mean a
change of salary resulting from a change of professional obligation. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
307.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
